Answer: It’s more fiction than fact.And it’s not particularly likely in any case.I work for an electrical manufacturer and I can tell you that nothing is going to “[wipe] out the entire US power grid”. It’s simply not going to happen. Even if it did damage a lot of major components, it’s only going to be a couple of weeks or months before it’s back to 100%.I have seen instances where large power surges hit certain facilities and took out a large swath of equipment, but not where they took out everything. There is always a percentage that would still work.So, not going to happen.
name: Eric Houg
